questions.question: There is nobody ………………………
questions.description: No article is used in the expression at home.

questions.question: I am going ……………………..
questions.description: Home is used without to as an adverb referring to direction.

questions.question: I don’t think it is …………………….. to ask for his help now.
questions.description: Politic can mean wise or prudent.

questions.question: I knew something was wrong ……………………… I arrived.
questions.description: In British English, immediately can be used as a conjunction, to mean ‘as soon as’.

questions.question: I am taking an umbrella …………………… it rains.
questions.description: We use in case to suggest that we are doing one thing now because another thing might happen later.

questions.question: People call the fire force …………………… their house catches fire.
questions.description: We use if to suggest that we will do one thing if another thing happens.

questions.question: I don’t think his stories deserve ……………………
questions.description: The -ing form has a passive meaning after deserve. Deserve reading means the same as deserve to be read.

questions.question: Do you object to ………………….. on the weekend?
questions.description: When to is a preposition, it is followed by an ing form. This usually happens after expressions like object to and in addition to.

questions.question: Only after her death …………………….. able to understand her.
questions.description: We use inversion after restrictive words like hardly, seldom, rarely, only etc.

questions.question: I …………………… down and closed my eyes.
questions.description: Lay is the past tense of lie.

questions.question: You can make wine ……………………….. gooseberries.
questions.description: We use make from when a material is changed into a completely different form to make something.
